Money

29 Jul 2019 • 1 min read
project
ARCH30005: Design Visualisation: Digital Techniques / Semester 2, 2019
‘Money ’ depicts the lived-in space of an older, accomplished artistic, couple. The film continuously contrasts objects and elements of gaudy opulence, and elderly frailness. The song underpinning the film, Money, from Pink Floyd’s legendary album, Dark Side of the Moon [1973], creates an atmosphere of rock n roll spirit, which serves to further contradict both the tasteless neoclassical setting and geriatric artifacts littered throuhgout the film. ​ ​

A1 Rendered Movie Poster

This project was the end product of a subject that introduced students to design visualisation as a means of representation and story telling through architecture.

The 90 second film rendered at FHD/1080p, and A1 poster were created using 3DS Max and VRay; from storyboard to premiere in just 5 weeks, along side my capstone project.
